types.name: Long
types.description: The Long scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Long can represent values between -(2^63) and 2^63 - 1.

enumValues.name: clip
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the specified parameters without distorting, cropping, or changing the aspect ratio.

enumValues.name: crop
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit the specified parameters exactly by removing any parts of the image that don't fit within the boundaries.

enumValues.name: scale
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit the specified parameters exactly by scaling the image to the desired size. The aspect ratio of the image is not respected and the image can be distorted using this method.

enumValues.name: max
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the parameters, but as opposed to 'fit:clip' will not scale the image if the image is smaller than the output size.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.description: Custom type representing a rich text value comprising of raw rich text ast, html, markdown and text values

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

inputFields.name: create
inputFields.description: Create localizations for the newly-created document

inputFields.name: format
inputFields.description:
Transforms a document into a desired file type.
See this matrix for format support:

PDF:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, png, svg, txt, and webp
DOC:	docx, html, jpg, odt, pdf, png, svg, txt, and webp
DOCX:	doc, html, jpg, odt, pdf, png, svg, txt, and webp
ODT:	doc, docx, html, jpg, pdf, png, svg, txt, and webp
XLS:	jpg, pdf, ods, png, svg, xlsx, and webp
XLSX:	jpg, pdf, ods, png, svg, xls, and webp
ODS:	jpg, pdf, png, xls, svg, xlsx, and webp
PPT:	jpg, odp, pdf, png, svg, pptx, and webp
PPTX:	jpg, odp, pdf, png, svg, ppt, and webp
ODP:	jpg, pdf, png, ppt, svg, pptx, and webp
BMP:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
GIF:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
JPG:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
PNG:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
WEBP:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
TIFF:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
AI:	    jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
PSD:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
SVG:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, and webp
HTML:	jpg, odt, pdf, svg, txt, and webp
TXT:	jpg, html, odt, pdf, svg, and webp

inputFields.name: width
inputFields.description: The width in pixels to resize the image to. The value must be an integer from 1 to 10000.

inputFields.name: height
inputFields.description: The height in pixels to resize the image to. The value must be an integer from 1 to 10000.

inputFields.name: fit
inputFields.description: The default value for the fit parameter is fit:clip.

types.name: Asset
types.description: Asset system model

fields.name: localizations
fields.description: Get the other localizations for this document

args.name: locales
args.description: Potential locales that should be returned

args.name: includeCurrent
args.description: Decides if the current locale should be included or not

fields.name: documentInStages
fields.description: Get the document in other stages

args.name: stages
args.description: Potential stages that should be returned

args.name: includeCurrent
args.description: Decides if the current stage should be included or not

args.name: inheritLocale
args.description: Decides if the documents should match the parent documents locale or should use the fallback order defined in the tree

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time the document was created

args.name: variation
args.description: Variation of DateTime field to return, allows value from base document, current localization, or combined by returning the newer value of both

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The time the document was updated

args.name: variation
args.description: Variation of DateTime field to return, allows value from base document, current localization, or combined by returning the newer value of both

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.description: The time the document was published. Null on documents in draft stage.

args.name: variation
args.description: Variation of DateTime field to return, allows value from base document, current localization, or combined by returning the newer value of both

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: The mime type of the file

args.name: stageOverride
args.description: This is optional and can be used to fetch the document version history for a specific stage instead of the current one

fields.name: url
fields.description: Get the url for the asset with provided transformations applied.

inputFields.name: create
inputFields.description: Localizations to create

inputFields.name: update

fields.description: Delete one asset from _all_ existing stages. Returns deleted document.

args.name: publishBase
args.description: Publish base document including default localization and relations, as well as selected additional localizations. Returns document in mutation stage.

fields.name: unpublishAsset
fields.description: Unpublish one asset from selected stages. Unpublish either the complete document with its relations, localizations and base data or specific localizations only.

args.name: locales
args.description: Optional locales to unpublish. Unpublishing the default locale will completely remove the document from the selected stages

args.name: unpublishBase
args.description: Unpublish complete document including default localization and relations from stages. Can be disabled.

types.name: Json
types.description: Raw JSON value

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service’s schema, such as deprecated fields on a type or deprecated enum values.

args.name: fallback
args.description: Marks if the locale is a part of the default fallback

args.name: mutationInputFieldKind
args.description: Marks kind of mutation input field

args.name: filter
args.description: Marks filter and links to parent type

args.name: filterIsList
args.description: Marks if corresponding field is list

args.name: connection
args.description: Link to the Main type of the connection

args.name: documentVersion
args.description: Marks document version field on Query

args.name: relationKind
args.description: Specifies relation kind (e.g. union relation or regular field relation)

args.name: reverseRelationInputCardinality
args.description: Specifies relation input cardinality of reverse side

args.name: isConnectInput
args.description: Specifies whether type is connect input

args.name: isMemberInput
args.description: Specifies relation input to be for abstract member type, not known master / origin side

args.name: model
args.description: Specifies model a type is part of

args.name: systemDateTimeFieldVariation
args.description: Specifies mode of system DateTime fields

args.name: versionRetentionCount
args.description: If versioned, documents of this model will be able to hold this amount of versions per stage

args.name: versionRetentionPeriod
args.description: If versioned, on publishing versions older than x days will be dropped

args.name: id
args.description: hardcoded postgres id value for enums

args.name: idColumn
args.description: Specifies column for system id field

args.name: prio
args.description: Specifies column for native sorting for relational fields

args.name: memberColumns
args.description: Specifies columns for union member fields

args.name: allowed
args.description: is usage of that field allowed if not overwritten will also be set for subfields

args.name: allowedStages
args.description: stages that are allowed to be used by this subtree
